names.pinyin: shen fu long mu jue ni tang

actions: Settles anxiety, calms the Spirit, calms the Liver and anchors and preserves Floating Yang.
With Zhi Fu Zi, Ren Shen and Mu Li, for profuse sweating as found in Devastated Yang with Collapsed Qi.
Heavily settles and calms the Spirit, calms the Liver, benefits Yin and anchors Floating Yang.
With Long Gu and Bai Shao, for anxiety, palpitations, insomnia, and dream disturbed sleep.
Powerfully tonifies Yuan Qi, tonifies Heart Qi and calms the Spirit.
Nourishes the Blood and astringes Yin.
With Long Gu and Mu Li, for spontaneous sweating and night sweats due to Yin Deficiency.
Restores Devastated Yang ,d rescues from rebellion, warms Ming Men Fire, assists Heart, Kidney and Spleen Yang, disperses Cold and Dampness, warms the channels and stops pain.
With Ren Shen, for severe Deficiency of the Source Qi and Collapse of Yang with Cold extremities, sweating, weak breathing, dizziness, and an extremely pale complexion.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
With Ren Shen, relieves palpitations and anxiety.

syndromes: Heart Yang Deficiency Exhaustion: Vanquished Yang
Yang Deficiency on the Verge of Collapse

symptoms: Great perspiration with dibbling and dripping
Reversal Cold of the four limbs
manifestations.pulse: Thin, on the verge of expiring
